required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Estimation Study to Assess the Effect of Severe Renal Impairment and End-stage Renal Disease Hemodialysis on the Pharmacokinetics of Evolocumab
clinical_study.official_title: Phase 1, Open-label, Single-dose Study of Evolocumab (AMG 145) Administered Subcutaneously to Subjects With Normal Renal Function or Severe Renal Impairment or End Stage Renal Disease Receiving Hemodialysis

brief_summary.textblock: The primary objective of this study was to evaluate the pharmacokinetics of evolocumab after a single 140 mg subcutaneous (SC) dose in adults with normal renal function or severe renal impairment or end-stage renal disease (ESRD) receiving hemodialysis.

primary_outcome.measure: Maximum Observed Serum Concentration (Cmax) of Evolocumab
primary_outcome.time_frame: Predose and 4 hours, 2, 3, 4, 6, 8, 11, 15, 22, 29, 43, 50 and 57 days postdose
primary_outcome.description: Serum concentrations of evolocumab were measured by a validated enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay (ELISA). The lower limit of quantification (LLOQ) of the assay was 800 ng/mL.

primary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Concentration-time Curve From Time 0 to Time of Last Quantifiable Concentration (AUC0-last) for Evolocumab
primary_outcome.time_frame: Predose and 4 hours, 2, 3, 4, 6, 8, 11, 15, 22, 29, 43, 50 and 57 days postdose

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Adverse Events
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the first dose of study drug up until Day 57

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Clinically Relevant Vital Sign or Clinical Laboratory Changes
secondary_outcome.description: The investigator reviewed vital signs and laboratory test results and determined whether an abnormal value in an individual participant represented a clinically significant change from the participant's baseline values.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Anti-evolocumab Antibodies
secondary_outcome.description: Blood samples were tested using an electrochemiluminescence-based bridging immunoassay to detect antibodies capable of binding to evolocumab.

secondary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Effect Curve From Baseline to Day 57 (AUECday1-57) for Low-density Lipoprotein Cholesterol (LDL-C)
secondary_outcome.description: The derived log-transformed AUECday1-57 for direct LDL-C was analyzed using a mixed-effect analysis of variance model. Log-transformed baseline LDL-C was the covariate.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Percent Change From Baseline in Proprotein Convertase Subtilisin/Kexin Type 9 (PCSK9)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and 4 hours, 2, 3, 4, 6, 8, 11, 15, 22, 29, 43, 50 and 57 days postdose
secondary_outcome.description: Serum PCSK9 concentrations were determined using a qualified ELISA. The LLOQ of the assay was 15 ng/mL. Log-transformed baseline PCSK9 was included in the model as a covariate and participant as a random effect.

arm_group.description: Participants received a single 140 mg dose of evolocumab subcutaneously on Day 1.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Body mass index (BMI) of ≥ 18 and ≤ 35 kg/m² at screening.
- Subjects will have low-density lipoprotein cholesterol (LDL-C) of 70-190 mg/dL (inclusive) and on statin therapy.
- Other inclusion criteria may apply.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subject with current or prior history of statin intolerance
- Subject has previously received Evolocumab (AMG 145) or any other investigational therapy directed against PCSK9
- Known substance abuse (eg, alcohol, licit or illicit drugs) within 12 months of day -1
- Testing positive for alcohol and/or drugs-of-abuse at screening, day -1, or day 1 (alcohol only)
- History of hypersensitivity or allergic reaction to mammalian-derived drug preparations
- Known sensitivity to any of the active substances or their excipients to be administered during dosing, eg, carboxymethylcellulose
- Other exclusion criteria may apply.

clinical_study.keyword: Subjects with normal renal function or severe renal impairment (RI) or end stage renal disease (ESRD) receiving hemodialysis

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Eighteen participants were enrolled at 1 center in the United States. The first participant enrolled on 19 August 2014 and the last participant enrolled on 28 October 2014.

group.title: Normal Renal Function
group.description: Participants with normal renal function (defined as an estimated glomerular filtration rate [eGFR] ≥ 90 mL/min/1.73 m²) received a single 140 mg dose of evolocumab subcutaneously on Day 1.

group.title: Severe Renal Impairment
group.description: Participants with severe renal impairment (defined as eGFR 15 to 29 mL/min/1.73 m²) received a single 140 mg dose of evolocumab subcutaneously on Day 1.

group.title: End Stage Renal Disease
group.description: Participants with end-stage renal disease (ESRD) requiring hemodialysis received a single 140 mg dose of evolocumab subcutaneously on Day 1.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.population: Pharmacokinetic (PK) analysis set (all participants for whom at least 1 PK parameter could be adequately estimated)

reported_events.time_frame: From the first dose of study drug up until Day 57
reported_events.desc: Other Adverse Events summarizes the non-serious occurrences of adverse events that exceed the indicated frequency threshold. Summary of Adverse Events includes only those subjects who received at least one dose of investigational product. ESRD = End stage renal disease requiring dialysis.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The Clinical Trial Agreement generally does not restrict an investigator's discussion of trial results after completion. The Agreement permits Amgen a limited period of time to review material discussing trial results (typically up to 45 days and possible extension). Amgen may remove confidential information, but authors have final control and approval of publication content. For multicenter studies, the investigator agrees not to publish any results before the first multi-center publication.
